metadata.title: CVE-2016-7069 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: An issue has been found in dnsdist before 1.2.0 in the way EDNS0 OPT records are handled when parsing responses from a backend. When dnsdist is configured to add EDNS Client Subnet to a query, the response may contain an EDNS0 OPT record that has to be removed before forwarding the response to the initial client. On a 32-bit system, the pointer arithmetic used when parsing the received response to remove that record might trigger an undefined behavior leading to a crash.

criterions.comment: dnsdist package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.0-1').
